page.title: 05Employment
page.content: The inhabitants of Deene & Deenethorpe have traditionally been employed by the Brudenell family, on the Deene Park Estate, but in recent years the number of estate workers has decreased. Some former employees now live in retirement in the villages, but most of the inhabitants are still associated with the Estate. It does, however, appear that many of the younger generation have moved away from the area to seek work elsewhere. Such a move gained momentum in the 1930's, when the steelworks opened at nearby Corby....and workers sought the earnings being offered in industry. Today, the majority of local workers are employed at Deene Park,with a small workforce on the farms. The only people working outside the locality seemed to be four women, who had found work in the Corby area.
